conbody.p: The Outline view pane is located at the bottom-left corner of the interface and shows a thumbnail view of the entire page flow diagram that is displayed in the Editor area. The thumbnail view is useful when you are working with large diagrams that do not fit within the visible space of the Editor area. A shaded box in the Outline view pane highlights the part of the diagram that is currently visible in the Editor area. You can drag and position the shaded box to different parts of the diagram that you want to highlight. You can also select to display a hierarchical view of all elements in the diagram. The hierarchical view is useful for locating specific elements in the diagram. When you click on an element in the hierarchy, the element is highlighted in the Editor area.
The Outline view pane might contain the following icons depending on the model file you are working with:

strow.stentry: (Only available when editing pageflow and workflow) Displays a hierarchical view of the elements in the diagram. If you double-click on an element in the hierarchy, the element is highlighted in the diagram that is displayed in the Editor area.
(Only available when editing pageflow and workflow) Displays a thumbnail view of the diagram. A shaded box is available to highlight specific areas in the diagram displayed in the Editor area.

conbody.p: Tip To enlarge the Outline view pane, use the divider bars to resize the area.
